author: A D Balasubramaniyan
text:
90 per cent of the employees of all departments participated in the strike, says president of TNROA

Functioning of several key departments in Vellore and Tiruvannamalai districts was affected due to the indefinite strike of the government employees.

Revenue department offices including taluk officesgave deserted looks .

School noon meal centres struggled to prepare food for students. District Collector A.Gnanasekaran said, “We have asked concerned panchayat presidents to arrange for alternative personnel to cook . We are planning to talk to office bearers of employees associations to make them give up the strike. ”.

R. Jothi Sankar, district president of Tamil Nadu Revenue Officers Association (TNROA) told The Hindu that 90 per cent of employees of all departments participated in the strike in Tiruvannamalai district. Court staff and employees of commercial taxes department too participated. All department pensioners association staged a demonstration in Tiruvannamalai to express solidarity with the striking staff.Demands

Main demands of the employees include replacing Contributory Pension Scheme with the conventional pension scheme, filling four lakh vacancies in various government departments, merging of Dearness Allowance with basic and announcement of interim relief before the seventh pay commission recommendation is implemented.
title: Government employees strike work in Vellore, Tiruvannamalai
